hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 6 and height labeled 4.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd725c5d0c64f9a592fef89272931457e2ac22a5)

The rectangle has $\tealE{4}$ rows with $\goldE{6}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each row:

$\underbrace{\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}}_{\tealE{4}\text{ rows}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}+\goldE{6}= \goldE{6} \times \tealE{4}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $6+6+6+6$
- $6 \times 4$
